dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of. Ted Peloquin--one of the  sweetest guys in the world. Healy TURNS UP THE VOLUME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was so shy and clumsy...I had a  major crush on him. BACK ON HEALY as he nearly puts his head through the roof He grabs hold of the steering wheel and pounds his head o it.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary                p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna go out tonight. Oh, that  reminds me, I've got to call what's- his-face and cancel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I sense a chill in the air? Mary sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Magda, I let my head get in the  way of my love life. I always pick  guys on what I feel in here. (pats heart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But with this Pat guy my head kept  saying "Grow up, Mary. You have a  lot in common with this one, you'll  grow to feel something for him." But  it never happened. ON HEALY - he couldn't look more crushed. Suddenly his  cellular phone RINGS. He stares at it for TWO, THREE, FOU RINGS. Panic-stricken. Then he answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jovial voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Patty-boy here. Sorry I missed  ya, but I'm out rustling up some  champagne and roses in preparation  for the greatest birthday of my life.  Hope you and yours are having a good  day, too. Healy makes a BEEP sound and then holds his breath. ON MARY - she stares at the phone, feeling cornered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, hi Pat, it's me, Mary. Just wanted  to say I'm...looking forward to  tonight. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You vicious bitch, how do you sleep  at night?
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary                p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it--I just found out it's  his birthday. (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I've gotta cancel on Ted. ON HEALY - he blows imaginary smoke off an imaginary gun. Then he sits back and smugly listens to her DIAL THE PHON But then he hears something that concerns him--a KNOCK on the door and the dog YAPPING. ON MARY - she puts down the phone and answers the door. I Tucker, the architect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker...come on in. BACK ON HEALY pulling his hair out. He's on an emotional  roller coaster heading downhill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well look who's here. BACK TO MARY'S APARTMENT - Tucker is carrying an unopened BOTTLE OF SCOTCH and absently flicking the YAPPING pooch his ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is--I brought you a little  thirst-quencher, Mag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you are sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. I just want to get you- drunk so you'll pass out and I can  have my way with Mary. Everyone LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I pour you one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I've got to be going.   Unfortunately, Doc, this isn't a  social visit. Tucker's tone shifts and Mary grows concerned.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary                p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I've got a little more news  about your friend Healy. Mary seems relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're going to say, but  he already told me everything. I  know he's not an architect. Tucker pulls out a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd better sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker, I appreciate you doing all  this, but I'm really strapped for  time here and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, the man's a killer. ON HEALY - he can't believe his ears. BACK ON MARY - as she lowers herself onto the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a friend in the Boston police  department. He faxed me this this  morning.  I'll just give you the  highlights. (reading from rap  sheet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a short stint as a petty thief,  Patrick R. Healy graduated to armed  robbery by the age of fourteen. At  sixteen he committed his first murder-- a pretty teacher's aid named Molly  Pettygrove. He was incarcerated until  age twenty-two when, despite a grim  psychological profile, the state was  forced to release him. In his mid- twenties and again in his early
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary                p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thirties he was suspected of homicides  in the states of Utah and Washington.   Unfortunately, the bodies were so  badly decomposed that there wasn't  enough evidence to hold him, and on  and on and so forth and so on. Mary looks like she's going to throw up. ON HEALY - he listens intently, his face ashen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puffy, get over here. We hear the PITTER-PATTER of the dog's nails on the floor then a LOUD THUMP followed by a YELP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little shit lied to me about  that guy! Mary picks up the startled dog and pets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this is happening.  I'm supposed to be meeting him in an  hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just calm down. It's going to  be okay. Tucker puts his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you two never hooked up is beyond  me. Mary looks fondly at Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magda's right, I'm so lucky to have  you in my life.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary                p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get all gooey on me now, you'll  give me a big head. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The important thing, Doctor, is you've  got to distance yourself as much as  possible without pissing this psycho  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Okay, I think I know  what to do. I'll call him right now. BACK ON HEALY - he looks stunned. His cellular PHONE RING He stares at it, then picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm out drinking champagne and  roses...and I'm really happy. Leave  a message. BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, hey buddy. Oh boy, am I pissed.  You're not going to believe this-- well, you'll believe it, there's no  reason not to--but I just got beeped  for emergency surgery.  Well, um,  sorry, but I'm going to have to bail  on you. As we hear a CLICK, Healy stares at the cell phone, seeth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker comes out the front door, looks around, then walks off down the sidewalk. ANGLE ACROSS THE STREET - on Healy, his steely gaze fixed Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna pay, fucker. Healy discreetly pulls out and slowly follows Tucker in h car. BACK ON TUCKER - He continues down the sidewalk, looking  back once or twice, apprehensive. He rounds a corner, the stops next to an OLD FORD PINTO. He looks around nervousl
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary                p. 12-16-01 again. Then Tucker DUCKS INTO THE DRIVER'S SEAT and DRIVE OFF. Healy pulls into traffic and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom's mixing a drink while Ted paces nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I'm fucking nervous. I don't  know if I'm ready for this, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax. Have you hit the cash  machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pats his back pocket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car clean? Plenty of gas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mints?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copped a tin of Altoids at the car  wash. Dom nods, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sounds like you're all set.  Just clean the pipes and it's a go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, clean the pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pipes? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You jerk off before all big dates,  right?  Tell me you jerk off before  your big dates.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01 Ted just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't jerk off before--?! Are  you crazy?! That's like going out  there with a loaded gun. No wonder  you're nervous! Ted considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it: After you've had sex  with a girl and the two of you are  laying in bed, are you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Dom shrugs...Duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm usually too tired to be. Dom makes a game-show BUZZER sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. It's because you ain't got  the baby batter in your brain any  more. That'll fuck with your head,  that stuff will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to believe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most honest moment in a man's  life is the five minutes after he's  blown a load.  That's a medical fact.  And it's because you're no longer  trying to get laid. You're actually  thinking like a girl. They love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ you're right.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet your ass I'm right. You don't  go out with a loaded gun, you empty  the barrels!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, I've been going out with  a loaded gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People get hurt that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom walks out of the lobby just as another cab arrives an Mary gets out. He sees and her and ducks behind a bush as she walks past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted has a newspaper splayed out on the counter (open to t bra ads) as he furiously FLOGS THE DOLPHIN (chest-high si view.) We see some balled-up tissue nearby. After several frantic strokes, he takes a deep breath and slowly and lo EXHALES, clearly having COMPLETED HIS MISSION. He draws a few more breaths, picks up a face cloth, and g to clean up. But something's missing: The Load. Ted looks down, checks his hands, pants, shoes, looks in the sink, finally glanc at the ceiling, with no luck. The Load IS MISSING!!!! That's when the doorbell RINGS. Ted couldn't look more  HORRIFIED. As he buckles his pants, he makes a last, panicky  reconnaissance of the area. The doorbell RINGS AGAIN and reluctantly goes to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted opens the door and Mary is standing there looking as  lovely as ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. She notices something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your ear, you've got something. MARY'S POV - a HUGE LOAD is hanging off of Ted's earlobe  like a drop earring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a gob of... Mary leans forward for a closer look. Ted is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that....hair gel? BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great, I ran out. Before Ted can stop her, Mary grabs The Load off his ear WIPES IT IN HER BANGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healy is still following Tucker in his car. Finally Tucke stops in front of a lavish Victorian home and gets out  carrying a pizza and wearing a PIZZA DELIVERY HAT. Healy SCREECHES to a sideways stop, jumps out and POUNCES HIM.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You motherfucker, you're a dead man! Tucker drops the pizza as Healy SLAMS HIM into a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cowering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Pat, take it easy--don't do  anything stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck do you think you are  making up that bullshit about me?! Healy SLAMS HIM AGAINST THE TREE AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa--I don't know what you're  talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this'll jog your memory. Healy SLAPS him across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a hint--it's got  something to do with me being a  murderer. Healy raises his arm again and Tucker tries to shield him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I might've gotten some  bad information. Healy grabs him by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stalker Ted got to you, right?   You're working for him, aren't you,  you little shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Healy throws Tucker to the ground and takes off his sport coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your last chance, you fuck.  Now either you come clean or I'm
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: going to kick your ass from here to  Tallahassee. Healy grabs Tucker by the hair and cocks his arm.

dialogues.speaker: I LOVE HER, OKAY
dialogues.text: Tucker suddenly gets emotional. Healy stops and looks at  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me, goddamnit. I...I love  her. Healy slowly lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a phony--just like you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I'm a fucking fraud. I'm no  architect. Don't be a putz--who's  been to Santiago twice in a year? (scoffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estadio Olimpico--please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...but you knew people at Harvard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew shit. The only thing I knew  was that you were a fake and I made  up everything else. (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My real name's Norm. I deliver pizzas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Tucker rolls his eyes and pulls out his PIZZA DELIVERY BA with him pictured beside the name Norman Plante. As Healy let's this sink in, we
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted's rolling a little wine around in a glass. He takes a sip, nods his approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, that's great. The WAITER turns to Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame? ANGLE ON MARY - The light, puffy bangs that Mary started night with are gone, replaced by a glazed, ACE VENTURA-ST WAVE up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The waiter pours her a glass and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now by killer, you mean...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean he murdered someone and did  time back in Boston. The guy's a  freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Mary...I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, lucky for me I found out. Thank  God I have friends like Tucker. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sick of talking about  stalkers. (big smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healy and Tucker are bonding over a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So then in '94 I went back to  Dade Community College for a semester
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and when the Wal-Mart cashier job  fell through I hooked up with the  Pizza Barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you met Mary how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just dumb luck. I delivered a pie to  her one night and she answered the  door in her nightgown--that was it  for me. I went home that night, shaved  my beard, and a week later I was  laid out in her office with a broken  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you manage that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-factly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend. Baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, the plan was going along  just fine until you showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey, I'm not the one who  started telling bald-faced lies about  the competition--that's crossing the  line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What line? The day you first laid  your oily rap on my future wife you  started a war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Future wife? Get real, man--you're  nothing more than a glorified brother  in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you son of a-- Tucker grabs Healy by the jacket.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, calm down, calm down--the bottom  line is neither of us are going to  get her if we don't do something  about that headcase she's with now. As Tucker slowly releases him, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Mary are eating CORNDOGS at the snack bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hit the ball pretty good for a  fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No short game. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should play some time...I mean,  if you can afford to lose some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit, a twenty-two doesn't carry  a one-iron--don't sandbag me, lady. Mary smiles coyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sometimes I'm a nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more like it. (to Counter-Man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more nitrate-sicles please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it. Mary is amused by this.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nitrate-sicles--I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say they should put more meats on  a stick, you know? They got a lot of  sweets on sticks--popsicles,  fudgesicles, lollipops--but hardly  any meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree there should be more. The Counter-Man hands each of them another corndog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'd like to see? Meat  in a cone. You could put corned beef  hash in a cone, or chopped liver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it. And think of the toppings-- cheese, mushrooms, mint jelly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention ketchup and hot  peppers. They smile at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too bad you don't live down  here, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a lot in common. Ted takes a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...why don't you move back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, my roots here are too deep. I  love my practice, the people I work  with, Warren's got a nice thing going (joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just move down here  and marry me?
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01 Mary smiles and Ted LAUGHS...perhaps a little too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Mary are sitting on her front stoop SMOKING A BON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're a writer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well good for you. I bet it works  out for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see. If it doesn't, what the  hell, at least I gave it a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. And the good thing is  you can do it anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, Mare? How the hell'd  you manage to stay single?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...My friends think I'm  too picky. I think I'm just a weirdo  magnet. I did come close once--just  last year, in fact. There was this  guy he lived in San Francisco. ANGLE ON the corner of building. We see Healy and Tucker  SPYING ON THEM from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stalkin' son-of-a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking sickening. Healy and Tucker duck back into the alley.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healy is throwing DOGGIE TREATS through an open THIRD-FLO WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the TELEVISION and see Magda DOZING on the couch  with a watery COCKTAIL IN HER HAND and the dog Puffy at h feet. Suddenly a DOGGIE TREAT flies through the window, landing the rug. Puffy SNAPS TO ATTENTION and approaches the trea He sniffs it, then GOBBLES IT UP. ANOTHER doggie treat la beside him and he eats that, too. Then ANOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker keeps throwing the treats up and Healy looks conce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That seems like a lot of speed for a  little pooch--you sure it won't kill  him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said that. As Tucker throws another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doggie treat LANDS IN MAGDA'S COCKTAIL, waking her up Magda looks around, gets her bearings, and then DOWNS THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary and Ted, still sitting on the stoop. Mary seems a li reflective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then it was all over.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't spoken since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That's too bad. He sounds almost  perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...almost. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come up and watch  Sportscenter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh no. I think I'm gonna get out  while I'm ahead. Mary looks a little disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted...you're not that far ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mary, the truth is...I'll be  in town for a while now but I don't  think we should see each other for a  few weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...to be honest....I'm really  crazy about you and it's making me  nervous and when I get nervous I'm  not myself and I'm afraid I'm going  to doing something really dumb before  we get started so I think I should  just lay back until I regain my  composure. Mary sort of smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really sweet, Ted, but you  should save it for one of your books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's go.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01 Ted jumps up and starts up the stairs two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ted and Mary ENTER, we see Magda HOLDING UP THE COUCH  with one hand and VACUUMING WITH THE OTHER. Mary doesn't know what to make of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magda, what are you doing? Magda turns off the vacuum and we hear a BANGING SOUND co with the O.S. MUFFLED YAPPING of Puffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi hon. Just straightening up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Puffy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, he was being a pest so I put him  in the bathroom. As the O.S. YAPPING AND BANGING continues, Magda PICKS UP THE TELEVISION and starts DUSTING the TV stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ted, concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Ted, I need a moment with Magda-- would you let the dog out of the  bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Ted walks down the hall, following the YAPPING AND BANGIN SOUND until he comes to the bathroom door. The YAPPING is MUCH LOUDER now and he NOTICES SOMETHING THAT MAKES HIM  HESITATE.

dialogues.speaker: OUTWARD
dialogues.text: from the force of something BATTERING IT FROM WITHIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CALLING out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Mare, what kind of dog is Puffy?
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CALLING out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toy poodle! Ted thinks about this, shrugs, and opens the door. BARING HIS TEETH like a Rottweiler, Puffy SPRINGS at Ted' jugular!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted stumbles back into the living room with the hopped-up dog ON HIS FACE. He KNOCKS OVER A LAMP, tumbles onto the  floor, and fights for his life. Mary and Magda SCREAM as Ted and Puffy mix it up on the f Ted tries to CRAWL TOWARD THE DOOR but Puffy GRABS THE CU OF HIS PANTS. DOOR POV of Ted's anguished face as he gets pulled back i the room. Ted manages to GET THE DOG IN A HEADLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, you're hurting him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him...to calm down. Puffy gets a piece of Ted's wrist and Ted SCREAMS and dro him. Both man and toy poodle SPRING TO THEIR FEET. They start CIRCLING ONE ANOTHER. Puffy leaps at Ted and T SMACKS HIM into a wall. Unfazed, the dog gets a running s and LEAPS AT TED'S NECK. Ted manages to duck and PUFFY FLIES OUT THE OPEN WINDOW!

dialogues.speaker: TED AND MARY FALLING IN LOVE
dialogues.text: --Ted and Warren are at the top of a giant WATER SLIDE Warren motions that he has decided this is not for him.

Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01 Ted shoots him a look that makes Warren feel like a sissy Convinced it's not too dangerous, Warren decides to go fo it and Ted follows. --At the bottom of the slide Ted splashes into the huge pool of water, laughing, having a blast. Then he looks  around...no sign of Warren. Concerned, Ted dives underwat and a moment later Resurfaces clutching a GASPING Warren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Mary pumps Warren's stomach as he coughs water out of his mouth. Ted looks on sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Warren walk down a city sidewalk. As they pass a  shop Warren points to the window excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the window there is a mannequin dressed in a Super-her outfit, i.e. a generic superman. Warren then pulls Ted into the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted comes out followed by a beaming Warren dressed in the Super-Hero outfit. They continue walking again and a few  steps later Warren excitedly points to another shop windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the window is a mannequin dressed in a cowboy outfit,  i.e. Lone Ranger (hat, badge, holster, chaps, vest, boots spurs, etc.) Again, Warren pulls Ted into the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is window shopping with a few bags in hand. She turn and reacts amused.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warren is now dressed in the cowboy outfit and a humiliat Ted follows dressed in the loose fitting Super-hero outfi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Ted and Mary are walking arm and arm on a SCENIC PIER where PEOPLE ARE FISHING. Right behind them are Magda and Herb (the Homeless guy) enjoying one another's company. T is on top of the world, feeling good, looking good-right until he gets the HOOK IN HIS MOUTH. Suddenly he gets YAN OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Ted is FLOPPING AROUND on the pavement and a FISHERMAN has his FOOT ON HIS FACE as he STRUGGLES TO REMOVE THE HO Mary looks on, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Ted and Mary come out of the grocery store each HOLDING A COUPLE BAGS. Ted also is CARRYING PUFFY, IN A  BODYCAST. Ted PUTS PUFFY ON THE ROOF, then starts putting the groceries in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Mary pulls her car up in front of her apartment. AS Ted gets out of the passenger's side, he notices that PUF IS STILL ON THE ROOF. He quickly GRABS PUFFY before Mary  notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Warren is futilely taking swings in a BATTING CAGE while Mary looks on helplessly. Finally Ted goes into the cage, SIGNALS THE GUY TO STOP THE PITCHING MACHINE, and M WARREN A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE PLATE. --A distraught Ted SITS SOMBERLY on a bench. Beside him,  Mary comforts Warren whose LEFT EYE IS BLACK AND BLUE AND COMPLETELY CLOSED.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted shows up at Mary's apartment door carrying a BOUQUET FLOWERS and a BASEBALL. When he KNOCKS, the door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted peeks around the corner and sees a SOMBER Mary sittin on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chipper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Mary doesn't look up. Ted ENTERS, revealing his gifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flowers are for you and the ball's  for Warren. I had a friend of mine  Fedex it to me--it's signed by Tony  Conigliaro. Mary finally looks up but doesn't smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hire Pat Healy to follow me  around? Ted tries to hide his horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lamely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Mary picks up a letter off the coffee table and hands it him. Ted takes a quick look and then drops it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not true...right, Ted? Ted CLEARS HIS THROAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, funny story there. You see,  uh, it started out as a  uh...yeah...it's true.   Mary stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, hold on, Mary--it's not as bad  as it sounds. I certainly didn't  know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you put a murderer on my trail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yeah, I didn't know much about  him.  I just thought--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you think, Ted? That you  could spy on me and trick me into  thinking you were someone I  could...really go for? Mary starts to get emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, I swear I wasn't trying to  trick you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what the fuck did you do it  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it because because I'd never  stopped thinking about you and if I  didn't find you I knew my life would  never be good again. Mary looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (devastated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01 And so Ted does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted comes out of the building, a broken man. He paces bac and forth on the sidewalk, manic with despair. Then he se to grow angry. He rifles through his pockets until he fin a SLIP OF PAPER. TED'S POV - the paper reads: 'Healy's Miami address--229  Court Street, apt. 43.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted walks down a rather dark hallway until he comes to  apartment 43. He KNOCKS on the door but no one answers. H tries the handle and THE DOOR OPENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted ENTERS and immediately reacts to the STENCH. REVERSE ANGLE reveals that the place is a fucking PIG-STY DOG SHIT is everywhere, FLIES fill the room, a MOUSE scam across the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...? No answer. Suddenly he HEARS SOMEONE out in the hall, so ducks behind the door. Healy and Tucker ENTER the apartment and stop in their tr when they see the MESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-ly shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is a pretty nice place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sully...! What the fuck happened  here?! Again, no answer. Suddenly Ted SLAMS THE DOOR shut and gr Healy by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey!
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy, don't do anything rash  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tucker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in love with Mary, too. Ted releases Healy and glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucked me, man? Why would you do  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (righteous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean 'why'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the question, shitball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think everybody could use a drink. Tucker goes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you asked me to follow your  girl around, and I did and I started  to like her, and then I realized I  just couldn't in good conscience do  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn her over to a stalker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! You're calling me a stalker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right--if you weren't you  would've looked for her yourself!
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01 Suddenly they hear a SOUND and turn to see Bill the Boa  slithering into the room with A HUGE, GREAT-DANE-SIZE LUM in his midsection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sickened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Christ...poor dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a sick man, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well fuck you! You just can't  stand the fact that it was my turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your turn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, hot shot! My turn.  What's the matter with me, huh? Why  can't I ever get the great girl?   Give the big pig with the B.O. to  Healy, right? Well I was sick of it,  man! No more--it was my turn. It was  time for me...time for me...to be  happy. This is so pathetic that it actually gets to Ted. He sits down, runs his fingers through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you didn't have to blow us both  out of the water. Jesus Christ, just  because she found out about you,  why'd you have to take me down with  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about the letter, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Ted stares at him.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me you didn't send  Mary a letter outlining our deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck would I do that? I'd be  screwing myself. The guys stare at one another, then Tucker comes out the  kitchen with a drink. They turn their attention to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking prick, we had a deal-- you said you wouldn't fuck me and I  wouldn't fuck you until we had this  fuck out of the fucking picture. (moves in on Tucker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crossed the line, man. Tucker backs away nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, you're getting crazy  now. Why would I cross the line-- what do you think I got no pride? Healy grabs Tucker by the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear! I didn't tell her nothing!  You probably did it yourself, you  piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that makes a lot of sense. Why  would I rat myself out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I'm going to try to figure out  a guy who's idea of courting is  blowing farts in the chick's face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were following us?
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't flatter yourself--I was  following her, I always do. How the  hell you think I got rid of Mary's  boyfriend Steve? This gets Ted's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean...Steve didn't say all that  stuff about Warren?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you shitting me--Mr. Goody-Two- Shoes?  He was like a fucking eagle  scout. You two should be kissing my  balls--if it wasn't for me, she  might've married that schmuck! Ted thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell with you both--I'm out of  here. Ted walks out the door leaving Healy and Tucker to stare  each other down. Just then Hal the Great Dane walks out o the bedroom with a CEREAL BOX stuck on his head. Healy do a double-take, then looks back at the snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...Sully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if it wasn't you who sent the  letter, and it wasn't me who sent  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON an alarmed Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woogie? What are what are you doing  here? REVERSE ANGLE reveals Dom sitting on her bed.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get my letter, Mare? The one  about Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sent that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. I was worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...thank you. But...you know  you're not supposed to be within  four hundred yards of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I want to tell ya. I've  been through two years of extensive  psychotherapy and you know what? You  were right--I needed help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cautious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great, Woogie, I'm happy you're  better--you seem...good--but...you  put me through quite an ordeal, you  know. Dom nods aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to move, go to court, change  my last name--you stole all my shoes! Dom stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. Mary turns her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, Mary. On my mother's  soul, on God above, on everything  that is holy to me, I did not steal  your shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woogie, I caught you red-handed.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I did, but I was in a  weird place then. He approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a break, Mare, I was nuts! Mary backs into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healy and Tucker are parked right out front LISTENING TO  THIS CONVERSATION. They seem concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woogie, please, you're starting to  scare me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell's Woogie? Tucker just shrugs. BACK ON Mary and Dom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking you to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gentle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mary, honey, you're taking this  all wrong. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Not until I get a little something  to remember you by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that! No! Somebody help me!!!!! Healy and Tucker jump out of the car and RUN INTO THE  BUILDING.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healy and Tucker STORM INTO THE ROOM and freeze at what t see. THEIR POV - Dom is cradling SEVERAL PAIRS OF SHOES in his arms and trying to crawl to the door while Mary holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one pair! You owe me that much,  you heartless bitch! Healy and Tucker grab Dom and throw him down on the couch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom, you're pathetic, fucking over  your friend Ted like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You fucked him over, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's no friend of mine. Suddenly Magda ENTERS from her bedroom. She's holding a h eaten BANANA SPLIT. Herb, the Homeless Man, follows after her, sporting a Tom Jones and buttoning up his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on here? At first no one knows what to say. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in love with your roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Christ, I can't take it anymore.  I'm gonna pack my bags and go back  to my own place. Magda heads back into her bedroom and Herb follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker, where are your crutches? Tucker is stumped for a second, then:
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (British accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting query, Mary... Healy slaps Tucker in the back of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up and tell her the  truth. Before he can respond, Ted ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well isn't this nice--now we've got  the whole gang together. Ted can hardly believe Dom is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom? What are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole her from me. Now I want  her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woogie and I went out for awhile in  high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Woogie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom Wooganowski. Duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But but you're married. You have  kids a great wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're so happy with them, please,  be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I may I have a proposal. Everyone turns to Healy.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say none of us leave this room  until our young Mary here stops  jerking us around and decides once  and for all who she wants. Now Mary,  I know this is difficult but you  really will be doing them all a favor  to tell them the truth about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? Why would I pick you?  You're a murderer. Healy glares at Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well...not exactly. You see, I  exaggerated a little there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean he's not a criminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God no! (pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just a pathological liar! Mary looks at Tucker, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker...not you, too? Tucker lowers his head and reluctantly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Norm. I live up in Pompano  with my folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus... Just then the door opens and BRETT FAVRE, the Packers  quarterback ENTERS, with Warren (wearing a walkman) besid him. Everyone is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mary.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is Brett Favre doing  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in town to play the Dolphins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called him. I told him to pick up  Warren and get over here.   Everyone turns their attention to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, I found out that your buddy  Tucker there lied to you about Brett. Tucker lowers his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett never said anything bad about  Warren.  He loves Warren...and from  what he just told me on the phone,  he loves you, too. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the guy you should be with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Mare. And you know  I'll always be true to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw shit, this isn't fair. Mary manages a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realized something tonight. I'm no  better than any of these guys. None  of them really love you...they just  fixated on you because of how you  made them feel. But that's not real  love...Thank you for letting me see  that. Now I can get on with the rest  of my life. Tucker, Healy, and Dom scoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please...
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't listen to him, Mary. It's a  ploy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so full of shit, Strohman.  Are you going to stand here and tell  us that you aren't in love with this  girl? Ted looks into Mary's eyes. She looks vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...that's what I'm telling you. (winks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, Mare. Ted looks Mary in the eye, then starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he passes Warren)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, Warren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh...? Ted lifts the earphones off Warren's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, Warren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Ted. Ted then WALKS OUT OF THE ROOM. They all stand there in  silence for a moment, then Dom turns to Brett Favre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Brett, any chance I can get you  to autograph one of these pumps for  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is walking down the street BLUBBERING LIKE A SCHOOLGI Everyone he passes stares at him. Suddenly Mary comes run down the OTHER SIDE OF THE STREET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted!
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01 Ted stops and looks across the street at her. He wipes hi eyes, hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot your keys! She holds up a RABBIT FOOT KEY-CHAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deflated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Thanks. They remain across the street from one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you mean what you said back there,  Ted? Ted starts to well up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I just want you to be happy,  Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I think I'd be happiest...with  you. Ted just stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fucking with me, right? Mary smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wiping eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But but what about Steve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, that'd make golf real fun-- the guy doesn't even drink beer or  gamble. Now Ted smiles.
Screenplay-There's_Something_About_Mary               p. 12-16-01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. The BEAMING Ted starts walking across the street. Suddenl BUS WHIZZES BY AND SMACKS TED BROADSIDE. He bounces aroun under the bus like a rag doll, then finally squirts out t back end and TUMBLES TO A LIMP STOP. Mary SCREAMS and runs toward the body as a CROWD begins t gather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
